intro: Dasiola elliotea, commonly known as the Florida morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers and twining stems. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in the early morning, hence its common name, and are typically blue or violet in color. Dasiola elliotea is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
